amy.title: Amy @ Powell Butte
amy.bio: By Katy Towell and named for composer Amy Beach, this petite antique-styled wonder is at the Oregon Historical Society.

aretha.title: Aretha @ Guero
aretha.bio: Designer Alison Pond combines abstract shapes and Portland iconography in this delightful little nugget named for Aretha Franklin.

cat.title: Cat @ Patton Square Park
cat.bio: This colorful upright, named for musician and composer Cat Power, embodies the shape of sound. Designed by Blaine Fontana.

clara.title: Clara @ Cartlandia
clara.bio: Designer Zach Yarrington wants everybody to PLAY this luminous beauty, named for pianist and composer Clara Schumann.

diana.title: Diana @ Pioneer Place Apple Store
diana.bio: Designer Cassandra Frances Swan combines contemporary illustration and cubist principles, inviting you to participate and play. Named for jazz pianist Diana Krall.

fiona.title: Fiona @ 8th and East Burnside
fiona.bio: This piano is a tribute to Prince and David Bowie by Doug Fir Lounge.

lili.title: Lili @ Mt. Scott Park
lili.bio: Take a moment to admire the detailed woodwork on this upright designed by Amy Ruppel. A delight for the eye and ear!

marylou.title: Mary Lou @ Portland Art Museum
marylou.bio: Be sure to read the legend of 'Fur Elise' on the piano. This amazing design by ZGF is incredibly detailed and entirely whimsical.

nadia.title: Nadia @ Youth Music Project
nadia.bio: The designers at Big Giant have merged the abstract and the concrete in a design that should be experienced up close. Call the YMP for office hours and availability

nina.title: Nina @ Tidbits
nina.bio: Designer Julianna Bright's sense of flow and energy move through this piano named for artist Nina Simone.

joplin.title: Joplin @ ADX
joplin.bio: Our first public piano from our first year with our first partner! You can play it when you are at the wonderful ADX facility. Go on in and give it a try! Open during ADX hours.

ellington.title: Ellington @ Martha's
ellington.bio: From 2015 and decorated in homage to the iconic PDX airport carpet, this piano has a smooth, quiet sound.

seeingsound.title: #SeeingSound @ CymaSpace
seeingsound.bio: From 2015: The result of a collaboration with CymaSpace, & Lucid Design, this vintage piano includes sound-reactive visualization electronics that respond to sounds and tones, music becoming light, color and movement.

liszt.title: Liszt @ World Forestry Center
liszt.bio: This piano is uniquely Portland and a must-see work of art.  Decorated by North and in its forever home at the World Forestry Center. Visit and play!
